title: How to figure out the technologies a website is using - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m a bit of an old-school snob,I view source.You can normally identify platforms by either a generator meta,or the html comments, or the resources and their file paths. THen you can look at the resources and see what libraries are loading,and what domains are being loaded from. Finally, you can actually look at the JS/CSS files and see what they do too. OR You can use the tools as suggested by Alan Yeats (I love BuiltWith),and Hayden Costa (not used that one - will look into it),as my way tends to be a little slower and requires a hefty amount of experience :D
Built With has always been my go to for finding what sites are developed with along with what other tools or Tracking is being used. BuiltWith Technology Lookup
